definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Green with red irregular spots, a bloodstone.
sentences.chinese: 綠色的石體裏摻雜着紅色的斑點，是塊雞血石。

sentences.english: The quality of this pair of bloodstone bracelets is very good.
sentences.chinese: 這對雞血石的鐲子成色很好。

sentences.english: After the Qing-dynasty emperor Kangxi, most emperors, empresses and concubines had their seals made of bloodstone.
sentences.chinese: 清代康熙以後歷代皇帝和后妃多用雞血石作寶璽。

definition: Four Treasures of the Study, namely 筆|笔[bi3], 墨[mo4], 紙|纸[zhi3] and 硯|砚[yan4]/the essentials of calligraphy and scholarship (idiom)
the strokes of a character/calligraphy and painting
writing on the ground with a large brush dipped in water
red coral/precious coral (Corallium rubrum and several related species of marine coral)
kesi or k’o-ssu, Chinese silk tapestry woven in a pictorial design
